label: ISE ANC Clear Endpoint Policy By IP Address Example
info:
This sample clears a Cisco Adaptive Network Control (ANC) policy from an
endpoint via DXL and Cisco pxGrid. The sample identifies the endpoint by its IP
address. The payload from the response received for the Cisco pxGrid request is
printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* The DXL fabric to which the client will connect has been bridged to Cisco
  pxGrid.
* The DXL client associated with the `Clear quarantine policy from endpoint` node has been authorized to perform `DXL Cisco pxGrid Queries`
  (see [Authorize Client to Use Cisco pxGrid via DXL](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-pxgrid-client-python/pydoc/pxgridauth.html)).
* Import and run the `ISE ANC Apply Endpoint Policy By IP Address` example to
  apply a policy to an endpoint. A run of this example can then clear
  the policy.

### Setup

* Edit the `Specify IP address` node and modify the `Payload` property with the
  IP address of an endpoint for which to clear the `quarantine_policy`.
  For example:

  ```
  192.168.1.1
  ```

* To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
  screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
  with the word `connected` should appear under the
  `Clear quarantine policy from endpoint` node.

### Running

To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
`Specify IP address` node.

### Output

If the policy can be cleared successfully, the following message will be
displayed to the Node-RED `debug` tab:

```
â–¶ { ancStatus: "success" }
```

If no policy has been associated with the endpoint before the example
is run, the flow is halted with an `error.message` similar to the following:

```
mac address is not associated with a policy error associated with ip 192.168.1.1
```

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Specify IP address

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node injects a new
message with a `payload` property which specifies the IP address of an endpoint.

#### Set IP address request parameter

This is a `change` node which copies the value from the `payload` message
property to the `ipAddress` property. The `Clear quarantine policy from endpoint`
node uses the `ipAddress` property when constructing the parameters for the
Cisco pxGrid clear endpoint policy request. 

#### Clear quarantine policy from endpoint

This is an `ise anc clear endpoint policy by ip` node. This node connects to the DXL
fabric and sends a DXL `Request` message to Cisco pxGrid service to clear the
policy from the endpoint.

The request message includes the `ipAddress` property set by the
`Set IP address request parameter` node.

The `Policy name` property is set to "quarantine_policy".

The `Return` property is set to "a parsed JSON object" to indicate that the
payload for the response should be added to the output message as a JavaScript
object decoded from JSON.

#### Output result

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on the
message by the `Clear quarantine policy from endpoint` node. If the clear
endpoint policy request succeeded, the object written to the Node-RED `debug`
window should contain a property with a key of "ancStatus" and associated value
of "success".

name: Supply the IP address in the 'Specify IP address' node
